snippet: The episodes, in Jerusalem and the West Bank, have added to fears that a third uprising is taking shape as the latest crisis continues to reverberate beyond Israel’s borders.
abstract: Two drivers plow their cars into Israelis in separate episodes in Jerusalem and the West Bank, killing one police officer and injuring three soldiers; episodes, coming amid soaring tensions fueled by religious fervor and Palestinian anger over control of East Jerusalem, add to fears that third uprising, or intifada, is taking shape.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Said Ghazali from Jerusalem; Majd Al Waheidi from Gaza; Rana Sweis from Amman, Jordan; and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The episodes, in Jerusalem and the West Bank, have added to fears that a third uprising is taking shape as the latest crisis continues to reverberate beyond Israel’s borders.

headline.main: 2 Drivers Plow Into Israelis, Fueling Fears of New Palestinian Uprising
headline.print_headline: 2 Drivers Plow Into Israelis, Fueling Fears of New Palestinian Uprising
